title: "Hearty Welcome": President Murmu As Shubhanshu Shukla Returns To Earth
content: President Droupadi Murmu on Tuesday congratulated Shubhanshu Shukla as he returned to Earth after his 20-day space sojourn, and said his role in piloting Axiom Mission 4 to the International Space Station has created a new milestone for

title: 875 Palestinians Killed In 6 Weeks At Gaza Aid Points: UN Human Rights Office
content: The UN rights office said it had recorded at least 875 killings within the past six weeks at aid points in Gaza run by the US - and Israeli-backed Gaza Humanitarian Foundation and convoys run by other relief groups, including the United Nations.

title: "Pahalgam Attack Deliberate": S Jaishankar At Key SCO Meet
content: Foreign Minister S Jaishankar on Tuesday raised the issue of the terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalgam at the meeting of the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation (SCO) Council in Tianjin.

title: 3 Judges, 3 Cases, 2 Days: Supreme Court's 'Balance' Message On Free Speech
content: Three cases, three benches, two days -- the Supreme Court is sending a clear message: freedom of expression is not absolute

title: Living With Lover, UP Woman Strangles 5-Year-Old Daughter, Blames Husband
content: A woman, living in with her lover, has been arrested for strangling her five-year-old daughter at a Lucknow home late on Monday night and then pinning the blame on her husband, said the police.

title: Immigration Raids In California Strawberry Fields, Sow Fear Among Farmers
content: Flor, a Mexican migrant, picks strawberries in the agricultural town of Oxnard, but immigration roundups in recent weeks have infused the farmworker community in the strawberry capital of California with stress and fear.

title: 1 In 10 Children Screened In UN Agency's Gaza Clinics Malnourished: Report
content: One in 10 children screened in clinics run by the United Nations refugee agency in Gaza since 2024 has been malnourished. Since January 2024, UNRWA said it had screened more than 240,000 boys and girls under the age of five in its clinics.

title: "We Are All Under Threat": Anti-Drone Nets Cover Ukrainian Frontline Roads
content: A ravaged car with its engine destroyed and doors riddled with shrapnel lay on the side of the road near Dobropillia, a sleepy town not far from the front line in eastern Ukraine.

title: Samay Raina's Remarks On People With Disabilities "Disturbing": Supreme Court
content: Terming jokes made by standup comic Samay Raina and other comedians on persons with disabilities and those suffering from rare diseases "disturbing," the Supreme Court has said it will "scrutinise individual conduct minutely".

title: "Lifted India's Aspirations": Rajnath Singh On Shubhanshu Shukla's Return From Space
content: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh on Tuesday said Shubhanshu Shukla has not just touched space, but also "lifted India's aspirations to new heights" after the first Indian astronaut to visit the International Space Station returned to Earth after a 20-d

title: Tesla Debuts In India, To Compete For 1% Slice Of Total Car Sales
content: Tesla opened its first showroom in on Tuesday, marking the electric vehicle maker's long-anticipated debut in the world's third-biggest automotive market.

title: Cake, Tears, Smiles: How Shubhanshu Shukla's Family Celebrated His Return From Space
content: Astronaut Shubhanshu Shukla returned to earth after 18 days on the International Space Station. The SpaceX Dragon carrying Shubhanshu Shukla and three others splashed down near San Diego, on Tuesday.

title: "Fantasy-Land Auschwitz": Holocaust AI Fakes Upset Victims' Families
content: The Facebook post shows a photo of a pretty curly-haired girl on a tricycle and says she is Hannelore Kaufmann, 13-year-old from Berlin who died in the Auschwitz concentration camp.

title: Trump Encouraged Ukraine To Step Up Deep Strikes Against Russia: Report
content: US President Donald Trump has privately encouraged Ukraine to step up deep strikes on Russian territory, even asking Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy whether he could strike Moscow if the US provided long-range weapons.

title: Shubanshu Shukla's Experience Extremely Valuable For Gaganyaan Mission: ISRO
content: The experience gained by IAF Group Captain Shubanshu Shukla onboard the International Space Station will be extremely valuable for India's Gaganyaan human spaceflight mission, said ISRO on Tuesday.

title: Bengaluru Student Raped By Physics, Biology Lecturers And Their Friend
content: Two teachers and their friend have been arrested for raping a college student in Bengaluru on multiple occasions and blackmailing her.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Why Are Maruti, Tata, Mahindra Making Fewer EVs?
content: If rare earth shipments don't resume soon, Indian manufacturers may be forced to import fully built motors from China, raising costs by 5-10%.

title: US Citizen Who Spied On Ukrainian Troops "Awarded" Russian Passport By Putin
content: Daniel Martindale spent two years in Ukraine after Russia launched its offensive, transmitting coordinates of military facilities to Russia's secret services. "long since proven with his loyalty and actions that he is one of us." said Denis Pushilin.

title: Over 5000 Cops, Drones Deployed For Kanwar Yatra Security In Delhi
content: Security has been beefed up across the national capital with more than 5,000 Delhi Police personnel and around 50 companies of paramilitary forces and drones deployed to ensure a smooth pilgrimage, an official said on Tuesday.

title: "Unacceptable": US Embassy On Recent Drone Attacks In Iraq
content: The United States denounced Tuesday recent drone attacks in Iraq, including ones that hit oil fields in the autonomous Kurdistan region, the US embassy in Baghdad said.

title: India’s trade deficit narrows by 9.4% in Q1 on booming services exports
content: Within the total exports, India’s services exports drove the growth; services exports rose to $98.1 billion in the first quarter of this financial year, up nearly 11% from the $88.5 billion seen in the same quarter of 2024-25; merchandise exports, however, grew 2% in the April-June 2025 quarter to $112.2 billion

title: Balasore student death: UGC forms four-member fact finding committee
content: The committee will submit a “detailed report with findings and recommendations” within seven days, the UGC said

title: Amid lobbying allegations, BMRCL slashes land request for Hebbal depot plan
content: The BMRCL has reportedly reduced its land requirement to just 9 acres from the initial proposal to acquire 45 acres in Hebbal to develop a depot to house trains for the upcoming Phase 3A and a multi-modal hub.

title: Seeman moves Madras High Court for re-issue of lost passport
content: Justice N. Anand Venkatesh grants time till July 22 for the Neelankarai police to file a status report on the criminal cases pending against him

title: Discrimination against SC/ST professors in Bangalore University: CM seeks report from Principal Secretary of Higher Education
content: The Karnataka government had recently transferred five professors working in different universities in the State to Bangalore University without posts.

title: Nipah virus in Kerala: Screening along inter-State checkposts in Coimbatore stepped up
content: Coimbatore Collector Pavankumar G. Giriyappanavar is overseeing the screening activities and other preventive measures being taken by the health department in the district in the wake of the high alert issued in six districts in Kerala

title: Ungaludan Stalin camps get under way in central districts
content: Ministers Anbil Mahesh Poyyamozhi, S.S. Sivasankar, Govi Cheziaan and M. Reghupathy visit the camps along with the district collectors and assure people that their grievance will be redressed

title: 'Cheap politics': Pradhan attacks Rahul over comments on Odisha student's death
content: In a post in Hindi on X, Rahul Gandhi alleged the death of a daughter fighting for justice is a "direct murder by the BJP system"

title: Chief Minister launches ‘Ungaludan Stalin’ initiative across Tamil Nadu
content: Mr. Stalin also inaugurated the memorial hall and statue of former Tamil Nadu Congress Committee (TNCC) president L. Elayaperumal, a prominent leader who belonged to the Scheduled Caste.

title: Come up with simple mechanism to remove private images and videos of women from internet, Madras High Court directs Centre
content: Justice N. Anand Venkatesh expresses shock over a woman advocate having been made to watch her private videos and images along with seven male police personnel in order to identify the perpetrator

title: Rahul Gandhi granted bail in defamation case
content: The case relates to alleged defamatory remarks against Indian soldiers made during his Bharat Jodo Yatra in 2022, his counsel advocate Pranshu Agarwal said.

title: ‘We were not dying’: Russian woman rescued from Gokarna cave defends natural lifestyle with children
content: Regarding visa issues, Kutina admitted their documents had expired but disputed reports that they had overstayed since 2017.

title: DMK government stopped three-phase power supply to farmers: Edappadi Palaniswami
content: When Mr. Palaniswami was the Chief Minister of Tamil Nadu, orders were issued to provide three-phase power supply to farmers to ensure uninterrupted power supply throughout the day.

title: ‘Why don’t you feed them in your house?’ SC asks petitioner over feeding of strays
content: “There is all the space for these animals, no space for humans,” the bench told a petitioner who claimed they were subjected to harassment for feeding community dogs in line with the Animal Birth Control Rules.

title: Sivankutty stands firm on school timings change, slams Kerala Governor for ‘support’ of foot worship
content: Minister says discussions will be held with those opposed to it to explain the rationale and convince them

title: Supreme Court fixes July 31 for hearing pleas for review of 2022 verdict upholding powers of Enforcement Directorate
content: SC Bench adjourned the matter to July 31 after Solicitor General Tushar Mehta, appearing for the Centre, informed the court of his unavailability for hearing on Wednesday

title: CPI(M) moves Madras High Court against removal of party flagpoles from public places
content: The party’s State secretary P. Shanmugam, in his petition, says it is an intolerant idea of democracy to remove poles displaying flags of parties and trade unions which serve as the vanguard of the working class

title: Two lecturers among three arrested for rape of student of Moodabidri college in Bengaluru
content: The incident came to light when the accused allegedly started blackmailing her demanding more sexual favours

title: TDP seeks reforms in electoral roll, transparency measures in letter to ECI
content: Key suggestions include annual third-party audits under the CAG, AI-driven de-duplication, Aadhaar-based EPIC number verification, and enhanced public dashboards for voter grievance tracking

title: Congress targets Jaishankar over China visit, questions government’s silence on key bilateral concerns
content: Rahul Gandhi calls EAM’s diplomacy a “full-blown circus”; Ramesh and Shrinate raise issues of Chinese support to Pakistan and economic dependencies

title: Axiom-4 mission: SpaceX Dragon spacecraft carrying Indian astronaut Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla, crew members return to earth
content: The splash down occurred off the coast of  San Diego 22.5 hours after the Dragon departed from the International Space Station (ISS) on July 14

title: Nimisha Priya execution postponed: Council confirms progress in talks with victim’s family
content: Tomy Thomas, husband of Nimisha, says he is happy to hear about the news of her execution being halted. He thanks the Centre, Kerala govt and ‘all those who had worked together to save her from the gallows’

title: Pune Porsche case: 17-year-old accused to be tried as juvenile
content: On July 15, the Juvenile Justice Board rejected the police’s plea to treat the 17-year-old accused boy as an adult, as per the defence counsel

title: Nimisha Priya’s execution ‘postponed’, say Government sources
content: Nimisha Priya was scheduled to be executed in Houthis-controlled Yemen on July 16, 2025 on charges of murdering her business partner.

title: NCP unit in Kerala faces turmoil as Ajit Pawar group demands resignation of LDF legislators for alleged anti-party activities
content: Praful Patel disqualifies Kerala Forest Minister A.K. Saseendran and Kuttanad MLA Thomas K. Thomas from NCP’s primary membership for six years

title: Dumper's Derby: Raleigh first C to take HR crown
content: Mariners star and MLB home run leader Cal Raleigh became the first catcher to win the Home Run Derby on Monday night.

title: Report: Sternberg to sell Rays for $1.7 billion
content: Stu Sternberg has agreed in principle to a $1.7 billion deal to sell the Rays to a group led by a Florida-based developer Patrick Zalupski.

title: Miz on All-Star critics: 'They're not upset with me'
content: Brewers rookie Jacob Misiorowski, whose inclusion on the National League All-Star roster has created a stir, said Monday that he wasn't offended by the criticism over his selection.

title: World's oldest marathoner hit by car, dies at 114
content: Fauja Singh, who became the oldest man to run a full marathon in 2011 at age 100, has died at age 114 after being hit by a car at his native village in Punjab.

title: Sources: Jets WR Wilson lands $130M extension
content: The Jets and wide receiver Garrett Wilson reached agreement on a four-year, $130 million contract extension that includes $90 million guaranteed, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter on Monday.

title: Sirianni rips narrative that Eagles carried Hurts
content: Eagles coach Nick Sirianni offered a pointed response to the notion that quarterback Jalen Hurts was along for the ride during Philadelphia's Super Bowl run last season, calling it "bulls---."

title: 76ers' George has arthroscopic knee surgery
content: Philadelphia 76ers star Paul George underwent an arthroscopic procedure on his left knee Monday to treat an injury suffered during a recent workout.

title: Nakase joins in ref criticism as Valkyries lose on FT
content: Valkyries coach Natalie Nakase didn't hold back after her team's game against the Mercury on Monday night was decided by a last-second free throw following a questionable foul call.

title: 👀 Snoop Dogg helps Swansea troll Wrexham
content: Not to be outdone by Wrexham's Hollywood glamour, Swansea City enlisted Snoop Dogg to unveil their new jersey and take a shot at their Welsh rivals.

title: The best NFL teams of the past 25 years, ranked from 25 to 1
content: With 25 NFL seasons in the books since 2000, let's pick the 25 best teams. How many Patriots, Eagles and Chiefs squads make the list?

title: Ranking Collier, Wilson, Clark and the best 25 players in the WNBA
content: Where do Paige Bueckers, Caitlin Clark and A'ja Wilson land? Our midseason rankings have a new No. 1 and seven new players.

title: How Clark, Fever dropped 100 points on Paige Bueckers' Wings
content: Behind 13 assists from Caitlin Clark, the Fever put five players in double figures and scored 64 first-half points.

title: Before he was the best golfer of his generation, Rory McIlroy was an East Tennessee State commit
content: Fred Warren was one of the first college coaches to recruit heavily from Europe. And he nearly snagged a young McIlroy.

title: Open Championship: Ranking the 25 players with the best chance to win
content: Can Scottie Scheffler add to his major total? Is Jon Rahm headed toward big things at Royal Portrush?

title: Is it the coach or the program? Ranking CFB coaches while factoring in expectations
content: Is Ryan Day a genius or could anyone win at Ohio State? We break down 20 years of sideline overachievers.

title: PSG's Dembélé is the front-runner to win the Ballon d'Or -- but who actually deserves it?
content: Now that PSG have lost the Club World Cup, the 2024-25 season is officially over and we can pick the Ballon d'Or for the best player. Who really deserves it?

title: Reports: Spanish agencies want Yamal party probe
content: Spain's Ministry for Social Rights has requested an investigation into possible breaches of disability laws at Barcelona star Lamine Yamal's 18th birthday party, according to EFE.

title: Sources: Newcastle on verge of $93M Ekitike deal
content: Newcastle are on the verge of finalising an €80 million ($93.3m) deal for Frankfurt striker Hugo Ekitike, sources have told ESPN.

title: USMNT to play Ecuador, Australia in Oct. friendlies
content: The United States will play Venezuela and Australia in a pair of friendlies in October as part of its preparation for the 2026 World Cup, U.S. Soccer announced on Monday.

title: Chelsea's Colwill: CWC will be bigger than UCL
content: Chelsea's Levi Colwill has said his side is ready to win the Premier League and Champions League after they won the Club World Cup.

title: Arsenal target Mosquera confirms Valencia exit
content: Arsenal target Cristhian Mosquera has appeared to confirm his Valencia departure, claiming he is leaving "home" to begin a "new era."

title: Real Madrid sign left-back Carreras from Benfica
content: Real Madrid have signed Benfica left-back Álvaro Carreras for €50 million ($58.44m), it was announced on Monday.

title: Euro 2025 group games draw record crowds
content: The group stage of the Women's European Championship which finished on Sunday had record-breaking attendances with close to half a million fans attending games.

title: Modric joins Milan after 13 seasons at Madrid
content: At age 39, Luka Modric is going to try to help restore seven-time European champion AC Milan to glory after one of the most disappointing Rossoneri seasons in recent memory.

title: Euro 2025 Power Rankings: Spain still the favorite, England a close second
content: Euro 2025 is down to the final eight teams who have the chance to get their hands on the trophy in Switzerland. We ranked them in order.

title: Takeaways: Rating the tournament, best moment, surprise teams, more
content: The 2025 FIFA Club World Cup is over, with Chelsea crowned champions. Time to let our reporters who covered the competition chime in with their final thoughts on the good, bad and ugly.

title: Year 2 player spotlight: Maye, Harrison, Odunze among popular breakouts
content: The ESPN Fantasy staff lists NFL sophomores who are undervalued in drafts and others who are under scrutiny.

title: The New Orleans football camp that's keeping the memory of Super Bowl hero Jacoby Jones alive
content: A year after Jones' death, former Ravens teammates Torrey Smith, Bryan Hall and Ray Rice are among those helping Emily London-Jones carry on Jones' mission.

title: The Jannik Sinner-Carlos Alcaraz rivalry is one for the ages
content: On Sunday, Sinner defeated Alcaraz for the Wimbledon title -- the latest in a back-and-forth rivalry that will continue to entertain.

title: How Iga Swiatek defied all expectations to win her first Wimbledon title
content: After an early exit at her favorite Slam last month, Swiatek rebounded on her worst surface to take the Wimbledon title.

title: ‘Organised murder by system’: What led to Odisha college student’s self-immolation? 10 things to know
content: A 20-year-old student's tragic death after self-immolation due to alleged ignored sexual harassment complaint has ignited widespread outrage in Odisha. Protests and political clashes have erupted, with opposition parties demanding accountability and accusing the government of a cover-up. Arrests have been made, and investigations are underway as concerns over women's safety on campuses intensify.

title: No warnings for samosas, jalebis: PIB issues statement; calls claims fake
content: Press Information Bureau refuted claims about health ministry's advisory. The advisory was about warning labels on Indian snacks like samosas and jalebi. PIB clarified it was a general advisory. It aimed to make people aware of hidden fats and sugar in all food products. The advisory encourages healthier choices at workplaces. It does not target Indian street food culture.

title: 'Will cope': Russia hits back at Trump's ultimatum, sanctions threat
content: The Kremlin acknowledged the gravity of Trump's 50-day ultimatum for a Ukraine peace deal, requiring time to analyze the proposal. Moscow expressed openness to discussing the timing of further negotiations with Ukraine, despite previous talks failing to yield progress.

title: 'Shubman Gill vs Zak Crawley clash reason behind India's Lord's defeat'
content: Following India's 22-run defeat to England at Lord's, former cricketer Mohammad Kaif criticized Shubman Gill's on-field confrontation with Zak Crawley. Kaif believes the incident ignited England's comeback, particularly inspiring captain Ben Stokes. Tensions flared on the third day, culminating in heated exchanges between players. England ultimately won, taking a 2-1 series lead. The fourth Test begins July 23.

title: Tesla India launch: Anand Mahindra's message to Elon Musk; says ‘Meet you at …’
content: Anand Mahindra welcomed Elon Musk and Tesla to India as the EV company officially debuted with its first showroom, the Tesla Experience Centre, in Mumbai. Mahindra expressed optimism and acknowledged the competition Tesla brings to India's growing EV sector. Tesla has launched its Model Y in India, with prices starting at Rs 61 lakh.

title: 'Jadeja was hoping against hope, the real star was Bumrah': Ex-India cricketer after India's Lord's defeat
content: Sanjay Manjrekar highlights KL Rahul's consistent performance as a major positive for India, praising his improved technique and temperament. He also acknowledged Jasprit Bumrah's resilience with the bat during a crucial partnership with Ravindra Jadeja at Lord's. Manjrekar further lauded Bumrah's adaptability and impact with the ball across both innings, solidifying his legacy as a versatile player.

title: Tesla drives into India:Musk's EV giant opens first showroom in Mumbai- top 10 things to know
content: Tesla has officially entered the Indian market, opening its first showroom in Mumbai and displaying two Model Y vehicles. While deliveries are expected to begin after September 2025, the company plans to establish charging infrastructure and expand to Delhi. This move comes amid declining global sales for Tesla, offering a fresh opportunity in India's growing EV market.

title: Rishabh Pant's pain: Run-out controversy, 9 runs, and emotional message
content: England clinched a narrow 22-run victory over India in a thrilling third Test at Lord's, taking a 2-1 series lead. Despite a late resistance from Jadeja and Siraj, India fell short of the 193-run target. Gill highlighted Pant's earlier run-out as a crucial turning point, impacting India's potential first-innings lead and ultimately contributing to the defeat.

title: Perplexity CEO’s message to students: “You’ve got to live with that fear”; warns students about…
content: Perplexity CEO Aravind Srinivas advised AI startup founders at Y Combinator to anticipate that Big Tech companies will replicate their innovations, citing Perplexity's web crawling feature being copied by Google, OpenAI, and Anthropic. He urged founders to persevere, create differentiated products, and build resilient brands, as large companies may also attempt to overshadow their presence.

title: IND vs ENG: 'Really annoying...' — King Charles III sympathises with India
content: Following a narrow defeat in the third Test match against England, King Charles III hosted and consoled the Indian cricket team at Clarence House. He expressed his sympathy to captain Shubman Gill regarding the unfortunate dismissal of Mohammed Siraj. The King also met with the Indian women's team, who recently secured their first-ever T20I series win against England.

title: Netanyahu orders IDF to hit Syrian forces in Sweida; cites threat to Druze community
content: Following reports of an attack on Sweida, Israel struck Syrian military vehicles in the area. This action comes after Prime Minister Netanyahu declared the need to immediately strike regime forces operating against the Druze population. Druze leaders initially called for armed factions to surrender, but a subsequent retraction highlighted broken promises and continued shelling of civilians.

title: AI war: Zuckerberg ups the ante; offers Rs 1,600cr to Apple AI exec; here's who he is
content: Mark Zuckerberg is building a Superintelligence Lab, offering record-breaking salaries up to Rs 1,600 crore to attract top AI talent from companies like Apple, OpenAI, and Google DeepMind. This initiative aims to unify Meta's AI projects and accelerate the development of superintelligence, surpassing artificial general intelligence. Meta's aggressive recruitment signals an intensified AI talent war in Silicon Valley.

title: 'Can you hit Moscow?' Trump asks Zelenskyy to strike deep inside Russia
content: In a notable shift, Donald Trump reportedly urged Volodymyr Zelenskyy to intensify strikes within Russia, even inquiring about Ukraine's capacity to hit Moscow and St. Petersburg with the right weaponry. This conversation, following a tense exchange with Vladimir Putin, signals growing US frustration with Russia's refusal to negotiate and a potential move towards more aggressive tactics to pressure the Kremlin.

title: Rahul's dig at Jaishankar 'apprising' China's Xi; calls it 'full-blown circus'
content: Rahul Gandhi criticized External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar for briefing Chinese President Xi Jinping on India-China relations, calling it a "full-blown circus." Jaishankar met with Xi and other Chinese officials to discuss bilateral ties, emphasizing mutual respect and addressing border issues. He also conveyed greetings from Indian leaders and expressed optimism for improved relations.

title: Rookie cheerleader Cooper Maas quickly becomes Cowboys fan favorite
content: Cooper Maas, recognised for her role in 'Reacher', now shines as a Dallas Cowboys cheerleader. Her Instagram posts about resilience resonate with fans. Maas's journey inspires many. The Cowboys also announced cheer squad leaders Kleine Powell, Anna Kate Sundvold, and Karley Swindell. While the Cowboys aim for playoffs, Maas's popularity offers a refreshing story. Her story is winning hearts.

title: When will the Fortnite servers come back online after v36.20 downtime?
content: Fortnite servers went down as of 4 AM ET on July 15 for patch v36.20, and the downtime is expected to last for 2–4 hours. Players can expect the servers to return from 6–8 AM ET. The update brings with it superhero content including a Superman crossover, Blitz Royale, and Boom Bonanza event.

title: NHL trade buzz: McDavid weighs Oilers loyalty; eyes free agency freedom
content: Elliotte Friedman suggests Connor McDavid is likely to sign a contract extension with the Edmonton Oilers, securing his future with the team beyond the 2025-26 season. Despite recent playoff heartbreaks and speculation about McDavid exploring free agency, the Oilers' captain seems committed to chasing a Stanley Cup in Edmonton. Negotiations for a lucrative contract extension are expected.

title: Who is WNBA star Candace Parker's wife Anna Petrakova?
content: Candace Parker, who retired from the WNBA in 2023, is married to Anna Petrakova, a former Russian basketball player. They are raising their children, including Parker's daughter from a previous marriage and their two young sons. Parker playfully envisions her sons being drafted into the NBA in the future, highlighting their strengths and weaknesses in a humorous Instagram post.

title: 'Inspired a billion dreams': PM Modi hails Shubhanshu Shukla's 'courage'
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi celebrated Shubhanshu Shukla's return to Earth after his historic mission to the International Space Station, marking a significant milestone for India's space program. Union Minister Jitendra Singh also hailed Shukla's successful voyage as a moment of pride and glory for India. Shukla returned safely aboard the Dragon capsule, carrying valuable cargo and experiments.

title: IND vs ENG: Shades of Dhoni in Jadeja - England cricketer draws comparison
content: Jos Buttler lauded Ravindra Jadeja's resilient batting during India's chase at Lord's, drawing parallels to MS Dhoni's calm and persistent approach. Buttler highlighted Jadeja's fighting spirit and ability to handle pressure, noting his unwavering faith in tail-enders Jasprit Bumrah and Mohammed Siraj. He admired Jadeja's clear plan and the trust he instilled in his partners, even if unconventional.

title: Julie Cousins sobs as Falcons bench Kirk in Netflix’s ‘Quarterback’
content: In Netflix's Quarterback Season 2, Julie Cousins shares the emotional impact of Kirk Cousins being benched for Michael Penix Jr. Despite the difficult news, Kirk displayed remarkable grace by calling Penix to congratulate him. This act of empathy resonated with fans, highlighting the Cousins' resilience and Kirk's exceptional character amidst a challenging transition within the Atlanta Falcons.

title: 'Designed to ride elevators, board trains': China deploys robots for delivery
content: Shenzhen has launched a pioneering initiative using autonomous robots to restock 7-Eleven stores within its subway system. Operated by VX Logistics, these robots navigate elevators, platforms, and trains during off-peak hours to deliver goods. This innovative system aims to alleviate logistical challenges for store staff, replacing manual deliveries.

title: India’s June trade deficit narrows to $18.78 billion, services surplus stays strong
content: India's merchandise trade deficit narrowed to $18.78 billion in June, surpassing market forecasts and improving from May's figures, driven by decreased exports and imports. Merchandise exports reached $35.14 billion, while imports totaled $53.92 billion. The services sector contributed a strong surplus of $15.62 billion, with exports at $32.84 billion and imports at $17.58 billion.

title: Kerala nurse death row: Big relief for Nimisha Priya in Yemen; execution postponed
content: Yemeni authorities have delayed the execution of Nimisha Priya, a Kerala nurse convicted of murder, originally scheduled for July 16. The Indian government has increased its efforts to allow Priya's family more time to negotiate a resolution with the victim's family. Priya was convicted in 2020 for the murder of her business partner.

title: What happened to Eugenia Cooney after being AWOL in a livestream?
content: After a worrying live stream in May 2025, Eugenia Cooney has sparked a speculation of a death hoax, after she went radio silent, aided by a Meta AI summary and an alleged claim by a neighbour. However, there have been no any official confirmations, and fans are cautioned not to spread speculation and to wait until there is an actual update.

title: Eugenia Cooney death rumor resurfaces, AI content fueling up confusion
content: Social media is abuzz with rumors of Eugenia Cooney's death, fueled by AI-generated content and unverified claims. A Meta AI summary falsely stated her passing, while a TikTok user claiming to be a neighbor alleged witnessing an ambulance at her residence. However, fans express skepticism, citing the lack of credible sources and Cooney's history of social media breaks.

title: Director Pandiraj on deciding to not work with Vijay Sethupathi
content: National Award-winning director Pandiraj, whose upcoming family entertainer Thalaivan Thalaivi features actor Vijay Sethupathi and Nithya Menen in the lead, has now disclosed how, before this film, both Vijay Sethupathi and he had decided that they would never work together ever in their lives because of a difference of opinion.

title: CoryxKenshin scandal: Ex accuses YouTuber of abuse, manipulation on TikTok
content: Popular YouTuber CoryxKenshin faces serious allegations from TikTok user @pandaninjaxxofficial, who detailed a harmful relationship involving emotional abuse and manipulation. The accusations include disturbing audio clips and screenshots of messages, sparking outrage online. @pandaninjaxxofficial described feeling emotionally discarded and used, while CoryxKenshin has yet to release an official statement, leaving fans in disbelief and demanding answers.

title: Pune Porsche crash case: 17-year-old accused to be tried as minor; JJB rejects police plea
content: The Juvenile Justice Board (JJB) has denied the Pune Police's request to try a 17-year-old involved in a fatal Porsche crash as an adult. The teenager, accused of driving under the influence and causing the death of two IT professionals in May 2024, will remain under the juvenile justice system.

title: History repeats? Bashir to Siraj feels like Mushtaq to Srinath
content: Anil Kumble lauded the thrilling Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy despite India's narrow loss at Lord's, emphasizing the series' compelling nature. He highlighted the fine margins that decided the match, such as Pant's run-out and extras conceded.

title: ‘Illegal sanctions…’: China hits out at Trump’s tariff threat for Russia allies
content: China has strongly condemned Donald Trump's threat of imposing tariffs on Russia's allies, labeling it as 'illegal, unilateral sanctions' and 'coercion.' Trump's ultimatum demands an end to the Ukraine conflict within 50 days, threatening 100% tariffs on nations trading with Russia.

title: IND vs ENG: England recall 35-year-old spinner; Shoaib Bashir ruled out
content: Liam Dawson makes a comeback to the England Test team. He replaces Shoaib Bashir, who is injured. Bashir broke his finger during the third Test against India. England currently leads the five-match series 2-1. The fourth Test match will be held in Manchester. Gus Atkinson is also likely to return to the team.

title: Kerala woman, toddler found dead in UAE; suicide note posted on social media
content: Kundara Police filed cases against Nitheesh, Neethu, and Mohanan. They are accused of abetting the suicide of Vipanchika and her daughter in Sharjah. Vipanchika's family alleges dowry harassment and abuse. A suicide note detailing the torture surfaced online. The family demands repatriation of the bodies and a thorough postmortem.

title: Cricket: 'One can't be fooled for 5 years', Allahabad HC stays arrest of Yash Dayal over sexual exploitation allegations
content: The Allahabad High Court has granted cricketer Yash Dayal interim protection from arrest in a sexual exploitation case. Dayal is accused of exploiting a woman for five years under the false pretence of marriage. The court questioned the complainant's claim of being deceived for such an extended period, providing Dayal relief until the next hearing.

title: Bullet train project on track! Japan’s E10 trains to run on Mum-Ahmedabad route
content: India's first bullet train project will deploy Japan's advanced E10 Shinkansen trains, slated to debut in 2030, on the Mumbai-Ahmedabad route. While construction progresses with Japanese Shinkansen technology, Indian Railways is also exploring European and domestic partnerships for signalling systems and indigenous train manufacturing, aiming for commercial services by 2027.

title: India's Got Latent row: Comedian Samay Raina appears in SC; court asks him, others to file response
content: Samay Raina, Balraj, and Nishant Tanwar appeared before the Supreme Court. A petition accused them of derogatory remarks about disabled persons. The court directed them to file written replies. They must appear in person at the next hearing. The case involves an episode of India’s Got Latent. It sparked debate over free speech and responsibility.

title: Telangana bets big on experiential learning, but SEL falls behind: What students are losing out on
content: Telangana is leading the shift toward experiential learning, embedding activity-based education across its schools, reveals the PARAKH report. However, the state’s progress is undercut by significant gaps in Social-Emotional Learning (SEL), with data exposing emotional disconnect among students and teachers. Experts warn this imbalance could hinder the goal of holistic, future-ready education.

title: 'Provides no answers': Global Pilots' body questions AI 171 report; warns against 'hasty conclusions'
content: Following the preliminary report on the Air India AI 171 crash in Ahmedabad, IFALPA cautioned against "hasty conclusions," echoing concerns about a suicide theory. The ICPA has also strongly condemned the "reckless and unfounded insinuation of pilot suicide" circulating after the report's release.

title: Nate Munzer, a junior U18 player, punched by Grade A adult footballer
content: Bronte Joel Munzer, father of junior U18 player Nate, has publicly criticized the one-game suspension given to an adult footballer who punched his son in the throat during a match on June 28, 2025. Munzer highlighted the severity of the incident, where Nate was left breathless and with a throat infection.

title: Actor and producer Dheeraj Kumar passes away at the age of 79
content: Veteran actor and producer Dheeraj Kumar passed away today at 79, succumbing to pneumonia after being hospitalised in Mumbai. Known for his roles in Punjabi and Hindi films like 'Swami' and his production house Creative Eye, famed for 'Om Namah Shivay', his demise has deeply saddened the entertainment industry.

title: Watch: Vaibhav Suryavanshi creates bowling record in IND U19 vs ENG U19 - details
content: 14-year-old Vaibhav Suryavanshi added to his batting records at the U-19 level. Having already made a mark and collected multiple batting milestones in England, he got on the scorecard with the ball as well. After Day 3, India U19 team lead the unofficial Test by 229 runs at the Kent County Cricket Ground.

title: Odisha self-immolation case: Rahul blames 'BJP’s system'; Pradhan calls it ‘petty politics’
content: A political controversy has erupted in Odisha following the death of a college student who attempted self-immolation due to alleged sexual harassment. Opposition parties, including Congress and BJD, have criticized the "BJP system," while the BJP has accused them of engaging in "cheap politics.

title: 'Objectionable' cartoons on PM Modi, RSS: Supreme Court grants protection to cartoonist
content: A bench of Justices Sudhanshu Dhulia and Aravind Kumar, however, cautioned the cartoonist if he continued to share offensive posts on social media, the state was free to take action against him under law

title: Heeding farmers’ demand, Karnataka government drops acquisition of 1,777 acres of agriculture land in Devanahalli taluk for aerospace park
content: However, the government will acquire the land of those farmers, who have volunteered to give up their land, by offering them higher compensation and sops like part of developed land

title: Migrant detentions rekindle Bengali identity politics, trigger new churn ahead of 2026 Bengal polls
content: 2026 Assembly polls heat up as TMC accuses BJP of targeting Bengali migrant workers, reigniting Bengali pride narrative

title: Madras High Court stays order directing Sri Lankan Deputy High Commission to reinstate former employee
content: A Division Bench of Justices R. Subramanian and K. Surender say, it has to be examined whether foreign missions would fall within the definition of ‘industry’ under the Industrial Disputes Act, 1947

title: BSE building in Mumbai gets bomb threat, turns out to be hoax
content: A team of the Mumbai Police and the Bomb Detection and Disposal Squad rushed to the BSE highrise tower and conducted a search, the official said, adding that nothing suspicious was found

title: Explain the directives to food vendors along the Kanwar Yatra route to display their names, Supreme Court asks U.P. and Uttarakhand
content: ‘A directive to reveal religious, caste identities couched under the garb of lawful licence requirements is a breach of privacy rights,’ the petitioners said; last year, the apex court had stayed a similar mandate issued by the two States during the Kanwar Yatra

title: Final rites of Saroja Devi will be conducted with full State honours: Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah
content: Her last rites will be performed in her native village Dhashavara in Channapatna taluk of Mandya district on July 15, 2025.

title: Pantheerankavu robbery case: ₹39 lakh found buried in plot
content: Police could earlier recover only ₹55,000 from the accused. The money was found buried in a plot half a km away from the house of the main accused

title: Balasore student death: The story so far
content: After repeated complaints of sexual harassment by the Head of Department were reportedly ignored by the principal and other college authorities, the 20-year-old set herself ablaze. Here’s a timeline of events that followed

title: New gecko species from Assam named after Brahmaputra
content: Unlike most lizards of its kind found across the northeastern part of the country, the Cnemaspis brahmaputra is diurnal

title: Congress leader Ramesh Chennithala raises more questions on Anert solar pump tender
content: Chennithala asks if Power Minister is willing to have a forensic audit of deals undertaken by Agency for New and Renewable Energy Research and Technology in the past five years

title: Tourist dies in paragliding crash near Himachal's Dharamshala
content: Satish took off from Indru Nag Paragliding Site in a tandem flight with a paraglider pilot, but their paraglider crashed after a short distance

title: Hope rises in saving Malayali nurse Nimisha Priya facing execution in Yemen as talks progress
content: Discussions with family of deceased Yemeni national are aimed at reaching a final decision on accepting blood money

title: Telangana refuses to discuss ‘Banakacherla’ project at Revanth-Naidu meeting in New Delhi on July 16
content: Writes a letter to the Centre on July 15 morning reminding Central bodies have already objected to it

title: Old bridge collapses during repair in Gujarat’s Junagadh district, no casualties reported
content: The bridge in Junagadh, which links Keshod to Madhavpur, was under maintenance when the collapse occurred.

title: 35 IPS officers transferred in Karnataka, Karthik Reddy replaces M. N. Anucheth as Joint Commissioner of Police, Traffic, Bengaluru
content: The government appointed Deputy Commissioners of Police (DCP) for the three newly-created divisions with the Bengaluru police

title: Farmers in Kerala’s Kannur to stage protest against fertilizer price hike, subsidy cuts
content: Demonstrations, including marches and dharnas, are scheduled in front of Central government offices across 18 centres in the district

title: Kudawala distribute electoral enumeration roll forms to voters in Patna
content: People who have received forms from the Kudawala allege that they did not get any receipt and the form did not bear any bar code on it

title: P.V. Anvar plans Trinamool Congress revamp in Kerala; district meet in Kasaragod on July 19
content: Move comes after his unexpected performance as an Independent candidate in Nilambur byelection where he secured around 20,000 votes

title: Two SpiceJet passengers try to enter cockpit forcefully, offloaded at Delhi airport
content: According to SpiceJet, despite repeated requests by the cabin crew, fellow passengers, and the captain, the two passengers refused to return to their seats

title: IMD sounds flash flood alert for 19 Jharkhand districts amid widespread rainfall
content: Ranchi Meteorological Centre Deputy Director Abhishek Anand said the State is likely to experience widespread rainfall till July 17 under the influence of a depression and monsoon trough

title: Insurance companies urged to pay interest on delayed crop insurance claims in Karnataka
content: Senior advocate and farmer activist Vajnath Zhalki has urged the government of Karnataka and insurance companies to clear claims for the crop loss suffered in 2024

title: External Affairs Minister Jaishankar meets Chinese President Xi Jinping
content: In a social media post, Mr. Jaishankar said he apprised President Xi about the recent development in India-China bilateral ties

title: Gates fixed and locked up at Panchamasali Peetha in Kudala Sangama, but seer has no idea who did it
content: Vijayananda Kashappanavar, MLA, told reporters in Hungund that he had instructed the All India Lingayat Panchamasali Trust to lock up the premises as a security measure

title: Central Industrial Security Force enhances sports budget
content: CISF said in a statement that the recruitment drive started on July 7 and will continue till July 29 at 14 selection centers across the nation.

title: Maharashtra to enact anti-conversion law in December, will be stricter than other States: Minister
content: Rajasthan, Uttar Pradesh, Madhya Pradesh, Odisha, Andhra Pradesh, Chhattisgarh, Gujarat, Himachal Pradesh, Jharkhand and Uttarakhand have their own anti-conversion law

title: Kerala CM arrives in State after treatment in U.S.
content: Kerala Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan returns from U.S. after medical care, received by top officials at airport

title: PFI’s plea against ban not maintainable: Centre
content: The PFI challenged the March 21, 2024 order of the Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act tribunal confirming the decision by the Centre on September 27, 2022

title: Maharashtra hotel association held one-day strike to oppose duty hike on alcohol
content: HRAWI also wrote a letter to Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar, referring to the proposed hike, which may cause a sharp rise in the retail prices of alcoholic beverages

title: Bihar Congress condemns insult of Tushar Gandhi, great grandson of Mahatma Gandhi
content: Mr. Gandhi while speaking to The Hindu said that Mukhiya (village head) of the Turkauliya village made personal attack saying he was not the descendant of Mahatma Gandhi

title: Transition must be completed within a fixed timeframe, no room for negligence, says Yogi on school merger
content: No child between the ages of six and 14 should be left out of the education system, added the U.P. CM

title: Priyanka questions U.P. school merger decision, calls it directed against Dalits, backwards
content: If schools are located far from homes, how will small children, especially girls, walk several kilometers to reach school, she asked

title: Maharashtra clears Bill to include drug peddling and narcotics-related offences
content: Opposition has welcomed this move and raised concerns around the modus operandi of drug peddlers involving minors

title: Complaint filed against MNS chief Raj Thackeray for “provocative” remarks
content: Mr. Raj allegedly said that if people from other States are beaten, they should be beaten, but no videos should be made

title: Campus Mothers to supplement professionals, not replace them: IIT Kharagpur Director
content: The new ‘Campus Mothers’ student welfare initiative, seeking to enlist female volunteers to offer informal emotional support to students, was criticised by mental health professionals for being “gendered”

title: Indian astronaut Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla on track to re enter Earth’s atmosphere and splash down today: SpaceX
content: The Dragon, which is carrying the Ax-4 crew, will also announce its arrival with a brief sonic boom prior to splashing down

title: Indian Institute of Space Science and Technology researchers gear up to study seeds that were sent to space
content: Seeds of Jyothi and Uma rice varieties, Kanakamani (horse gram), Vellayani Vijay (tomato), Thilakathara (sesame) and Soorya (brinjal/eggplant) were sent to the ISS under the ‘Crop Seeds on ISS’, a project spearheaded by the IIST’s Space Biology Lab.

title: Kaziranga records high diversity of grassland bird species
content: A team of forest officials, bird experts, scientists, and conservationists recorded 43 grassland species across Kaziranga’s three wildlife divisions

title: In a first, President Murmu sanctions grant for Eklavya school toppers
content: Officials say that the NESTS had disbursed ₹62.40 lakh of this discretionary fund to 823 meritorious students who have secured the highest marks in their respective streams

title: Central Railway submits action plan on track safety to Bombay High Court
content: It informs court that the Mumbra accident probe is under review, while responding to a petition on railway commuter safety

title: Minister seeks Central support for rural livelihood projects in A.P.
content: In a meeting with Union Minister of State for Rural Development Pemmasani Chandra Sekhar on Monday, Mr. Srinivas urged to support micro-enterprises and food processing units in Amaravati and CRDA villages.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Arsenal battle Bayern for Palace star Eze
content: Bayern Munich will go head-to-head with Arsenal for Crystal Palace forward Eberechi Eze. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Tillman to Leverkusen: Can USMNT star fill void left by Wirtz?
content: Malik Tillman is coming off a career year and Bayer Leverkusen are in transition. Is this a perfect match?

title: Unstoppable Lionel Messi has Miami back on top
content: Lionel Messi registered his fifth straight multigoal game, propelling Miami to the top of ESPN's MLS Power Rankings.

title: A.P. CM launches portal to make drone services accessible to commoners
content: The platform connects users directly with certified drone service providers, thereby enabling people and government departments to request services as needed

title: Odisha girl who self-immolated on college campus dies
content: Odisha Chief Minister Mohan Charan Majhi expressed grief and assured the family of the deceased that all those guilty in this case will face the strictest punishment as per the law

title: West Bengal has fared better than national average on various socio-economic indicators: Mamata
content: Citing a NITI Aayog report, the West Bengal Chief Minister says the State fared better in areas such as employment, sex ratio and infant mortality rate, and adds that these achievements reflect the State government’s ‘continued commitment to inclusive and sustainable development’

title: BJP MP Ravi Shankar Prasad speaks to top police officers over increasing crime in Patna
content: Not only opposition Rashtriya Janata Dal and Congress, even NDA partner and Union Minister Chirag Paswan have also raised questions on the deteriorating law and order situation in Bihar

title: Congress urges State unit to launch protest against SIR in Bihar
content: The meeting, presided by Congress chief Mallikarjun Kharge, was attended by Rahul Gandhi, general secretary K.C. Venugopal apart from State leaders, including Pradesh Congress Committee chief Rajesh Kumar

title: SGPC receives email threatening to 'blow up' Golden Temple
content: Amritsar Police Commissioner Gurpreet Singh Bhullar, while confirming the email threat, said an FIR has been lodged on the complaint of the Shiromani Gurdwara Parbandhak Committee

title: Protesting teachers’ march to West Bengal Secretariat halted amid heavy security
content: Representatives submit demands to Chief Secretary; protesting teachers press for publication of list of ‘tainted’ and ‘untainted’ candidates, demand job reinstatement without reappearing for exam

title: First impressions of the rookie class and other key notes
content: the 2025 draft class hit the floor over the weekend at Las Vegas Summer League . no. 1 pick Cooper Flagg went for 31 points against no. 2 pick Dylan Harper and the San Antonio Spurs . sources confirmed to ESPN's Tim MacMahon that the Mavs will be shutting down Flagg .

title: New rules for EBUGs? 84 games? What to know about the NHL's new CBA
content: the current CBA runs through the end of the 2025-26 season . the new CBA is set to begin on sept. 16, 2026 and runs through Sept. 15, 2030 . it would make the fastest both sides have reached an extension in Gary Bettman's tenure .

title: Buzz: Hansen impresses, Wemby returns and storylines to watch
content: 2025 summer league has been filled with exciting rookie debuts . players looking to secure roster spots and chatter surrounding the season's biggest storylines . our insiders have been on site talking to front office staff and scouts as the future of the league performs ahead of 2025-26 .

title: Can Brian Kelly and LSU win it all?
content: coach Brian Kelly has worked at lSU for more than 35 years . he will join Nick Saban, Les Miles and Ed Orgeron as a national champion . the team has a unique focus taking hold in the weight room .

title: Favorite (and surprising) Day 1 MLB draft picks -- and Day 2's top names
content: the nationals select shortstop Eli Willits with the first overall pick of the 2025 MLB draft . it's time to look at which picks in the first round stood out most . some of the picks we aren't quite sure about on Day 1 will become clearer .

title: Kanwar diktat: SC issues notice to UP govt; row over asking eateries to display names of owners
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics .

title: Who are the NFL's best off-ball linebackers? Execs, coaches and scouts help rank the top 10
content: ESPN surveyed league executives, coaches and scouts to help us rank the top 10 players at 11 different positions . in total, more than 70 voters submitted a ballot on at least one position . each section includes quotes and nuggets from the voters on every player .

title: Klay Thompson fuels relationship rumors with Megan Thee Stallion
content: Klay Thompson's trip to the Bahamas led to the usual offseason vacation social media collage . rumors about the rapper's relationship started swirling after the rapper posted a photo on Instagram . in one slide, the rapper posed alongside someone, presumed to be Pete, facing away from the camera .

title: 2025 MLB draft tracker: Day 2 pick-by-pick results and Day 1 analysis
content: all 20 rounds of the 2025 MLB draft are in the books . the Washington Nationals select shortstop Eli Willits with the no. 1 overall pick . college pitcher Tyler Bremner and the Seattle Mariners nabbed another in Kade Anderson .

title: Euro 2025 Daily: England thrash Wales and avoid Germany, Spain in bracket
content: the 2025 women's european championship is into the final group games . we will update this file throughout each matchday with the latest reporting, analysis and fun from the competition . for roughly a third of the match, it appeared England were going to top the group (as France were losing 2-1)

title: MLB All-Star Game: Predictions and more
content: the 2025 MLB All-Star Game has arrived! will the American League continue its dominance over the National League? all-star newcomers, such as Pete Crow-Armstrong, and Aaron Judge will descend on the rest of baseball's best .

title: Shakur Stevenson showed that the fight in him is second to none
content: Shakur Stevenson beats William Zepeda to retain his WBC lightweight title . he was promoted to the co-main event of Ring Magazine 3 by Turki Alalshikh . the chairman of Saudi Arabia's general entertainment authority was elevated to the main event .

title: Fighters grades: One A, one F, and a lot in between after a weekend full of boxing
content: undisputed junior welterweight champion Katie Taylor wins by majority decision to remain unbeaten in their fight trilogy . it was a brilliant performance by Taylor, who decided to slow down the pace to keep Serrano guessing and out of range .

title: Axiom-4: Shux, crew exit Grace after splashdown - here’s how recovery happened
content: As a young democracy grows out of adolescence, its rolling out reels and reels of tales. If the first post office or a telephone connection paints one colour, the Stamp of a stock market scam or the ‘Jewel Thieves’ scandal paint yet another colour. If failure of a sounding rocket was a stepping stone, sending 104 satellites in one go was a podium. If farmer suicides are a bad climax, growing number of Unicorns are a grand entry. Chethan Kumar, Senior Assistant Editor, The Times of India, who alternates between the mundane goings-on of the hoi polloi and the wonder-filled worlds of scientists and scamsters, politicians and Jawans, feels: There’s always a story, one just has to find it. Read More

title: Christian McCaffrey and Olivia Culpo announce birth of first child with joint post
content: Christian McCaffrey  and Olivia Culpo welcomed their first child. The  San Francisco 49ers  star running back and former Miss Universe announced the news in a joint Instagram post on Sunday. The black-and-white photo collage included images of the couple in the delivery room as well each of them cradling their baby. McCaffrey and Culpo  announced in March  that they were expecting. A post shared by Olivia Frances Culpo (@oliviaculpo) "Colette Annalise McCaffrey" the couple wrote together on Instagram. Culpo posted a photo of McCaffrey with their baby on her Instagram story, captioning it: "Colette is so lucky to have the best daddy in the world. A love like no other." She also added a photo of McCaffrey consoling Culpo while in the delivery room, writing: "The scariest and most rewarding of all experiences. As soon as he came into the room I felt most at peace." McCaffrey and Culpo  married in June 2024 .
